title: Definitions
context: ยง373L-1 Definitions. Whenever used in this chapter, unless the context otherwise requires: &ldquo;Client company&rdquo; means any person that enters into a professional employer agreement with a professional employer organization and has covered employees. &ldquo;Covered employee&rdquo; means an individual who performs services for a client company pursuant to a professional employer agreement. &ldquo;Department&rdquo; means the department of labor and industrial relations. &ldquo;Director&rdquo; means the director of labor and industrial relations. &ldquo;Person&rdquo; means a natural or legal person. &ldquo;Professional employer agreement&rdquo; means a written contract by and between a client company and a professional employer organization that: (1) Provides for covered employees to the client company; (2) Describes the duties and responsibilities of the client company and the professional employer organization with respect to the covered employees; and (3) Includes a declaration by the professional employer organization of the professional employer organization&rsquo;s responsibilities under section 373L-6. &ldquo;Professional employer organization&rdquo; means any person that is a party to a professional employer agreement with a client company and whose covered employees perform services on a long-term, rather than temporary or project-specific basis. The term does not include temporary help services, staff leasing, or other similar arrangements. &ldquo;Temporary help services&rdquo; means an arrangement by which a person recruits and hires the person&rsquo;s own employees and: (1) Finds other organizations that need the services of those employees; (2) Assigns those employees to perform work or services for other organizations to support or supplement the other organizations&rsquo; workforces or to provide assistance in special work situations, including employee absences, skill shortages, seasonal workloads, or special assignments or projects; and (3) Customarily attempts to reassign the employees to successive placements with other organizations at the end of each assignment.
